text: Activation of <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is essential for thymus - dependent humoral immune responses and rescuing B cells from apoptosis .
Many of the effects of <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> are believed to be achieved through altered gene expression .

In addition to <extra_id_0> Bcl-x <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , a known <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - regulated antiapoptotic molecule , we identified a related antiapoptotic molecule , <extra_id_0> A1/Bfl-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , as a <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - inducible gene .

text: Inhibition of the NF-kappaB pathway by overexpression of a dominant - active inhibitor of NF-kappaB abolished <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - induced up-regulation of both the <extra_id_0> Bfl-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> Bcl-x <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> genes and also eliminated the ability of <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to rescue <extra_id_0> Fas <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - induced cell death .

text: Within the upstream promoter region of <extra_id_0> Bcl-x <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , a potential NF-kappaB - binding sequence was found to support NF-kappaB - dependent transcriptional activation .

Furthermore , expression of physiological levels of <extra_id_0> Bcl-x <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protected B cells from <extra_id_0> Fas <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated apoptosis in the absence of NF-kappaB signaling .
Thus , our results suggest that <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated cell survival proceeds through NF-kappaB - dependent up-regulation of Bcl-2 family members .
